description: The SNMP notification that is generated to provide an updated value
for a measurement. This notification does not contain the last trap
sequence number for detection of a missed update.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementReport KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementIndex u 9 KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementName s EXAMPLE KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementValue s EXAMPLE KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementNeName s EXAMPLE KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementCategory s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The index identifying this particular measurement entry. The name
not the index, is the primary key into the table. The index may
change with the device configuration, but will be as stable as
possible.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementIndex

description: The unique name of this measurement.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementName

description: The current value of this measurement as a floating-point value.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementValue

description: Network Element of the object/device that controls this measurement.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementNeName

description: Category of the object/device that controls this measurement.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementCategory

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP notification that is generated when the system cannot
store 7 days of historical data due to memory limitation.

event.Summary: Historical data limitation - system can only store $v1 hours of data

description: The range in hours of available historical data, which can range from 1
to 168 hours (7 days) depending on memory available within the system.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementHistoryRange

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP notification that is generated when the system historical
data limitation is cleared and the system can store 7 days worth
of historical data.
The range in hours of available historical data, which can range from 1
to 168 hours (7 days) depending on memory available within the system.
variables.name: KTXMEASUREMENT-MIB::ktxMeasurementHistoryRange

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP notification that is generated to indicate that the
measurement table has been changed (i.e. entries have been added
and/or deleted.)
This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime
